bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to [Hugh S. Cumming], November 1, 1921

div1.p: [Carter] requests a reply from Surgeon General [Cumming's] office so he can prepare the lecture as requested.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to [Hugh S. Cumming], November 1, 1921
div1.opener:
/LC
2121 California St., N. W.
November 1, 1921.
Surgeon General,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
Sir:
div1.p:
In a letter of the 26th. ultimo, I requested to be informed
whether the Bureau wished me to give my one lecture in the Public
Health Institute on malaria or on yellow fever or if it wished both
subjects considered in a single lecture. So far I have received
no answer to this question.
div1.closer: Respectfully, Assistant Surgeon General, (On Waiting Orders)
